contentrichtext.text: {{lunar crater data| latitude=35.2| N_or_S=N| longitude=151.3| E_or_W=E| diameter=41 km| depth=''Unknown''| colong=210| eponym=[[Andrian Nikolayev|Andrian G. Nikolayev]]}} '''Nikolaev''' is a [[Impact crater|crater]] on the [[Far side of the Moon|far side]] of the [[Moon]]. It is located north of the [[Mare Moscoviense]] and south of the larger crater [[Von Neumann (crater)|Von Neumann]]. Because it is on the far side of the Moon, it is not visible from [[Earth]]. The circular rim of this crater is not overlain by any significant craters but has been slightly eroded. It has an uneven edge and a wide inner wall. There is a shelf running around much of the wide inner edge where the material has slumped, and some [[wiktionary:terrace|terracing]] along the northeastern side. The interior floor is rugged in places, particularly in the eastern half, and is marked by several small impacts in the southern half. There is a small central rise near the midpoint. ==References== {{Lunar crater references}} ==External links== * [http://www.lpi.usra.edu/research/lunar_orbiter/bin/srch_nam.shtml?NIKOLAEV%7C0 L&PI photos of Nikolaev] * [worldwind://goto/world=Moon&lat=35.11798&lon=151.05340&alt=250000&dir=0 Find this location] with [[NASA World Wind]] [http://worldwind.arc.nasa.gov/] [[Category:Impact craters on the Moon]] {{Moon-crater-stub}}
